dcterms:creator: P. Troyan
T. Morrill
dcterms:description: The doctor-optimal matching rule is a stable matching rule that is non-obviously manipulable, meaning that doctors cannot easily manipulate the outcome to their advantage.
dcterms:title: Doctor-optimal matching rule

dcterms:creator: P. Troyan
T. Morrill
dcterms:description: The hospital-optimal matching rule is a stable matching rule that is obviously manipulable, meaning that doctors can easily manipulate the outcome to their advantage.
dcterms:title: Hospital-optimal matching rule

dcterms:creator: P. Chen
M. Egesdal
M. Pycia
M. B. Yenmez
dcterms:description: Quantile stable rules are a class of matching rules that generate stable matchings, balancing outcomes between both sides of the market.
dcterms:title: Quantile stable rules

dcterms:creator: P. Chen
M. Egesdal
M. Pycia
M. B. Yenmez
dcterms:description: Quantile stable mechanisms are mechanisms that select allocations based on quantile stable rules, providing a compromise between the two sides of the market.
dcterms:title: Quantile stable mechanisms

dcterms:creator: J. Hatfield
P. Milgrom
dcterms:description: Matching with contracts refers to a model where agents can sign contracts that define their relationships, allowing for more complex interactions than traditional matching models.
dcterms:title: Matching with contracts

dcterms:creator: D. Gale
L. Shapley
dcterms:description: The college admissions problem is a classic matching problem that explores the stability of matchings in a two-sided market.
dcterms:title: College admissions problem

dcterms:creator: R. Martínez
J. Massó
A. Neme
J. Oviedo
dcterms:description: Group strategy-proof mechanisms are mechanisms designed to prevent groups of agents from manipulating the outcome of a matching.
dcterms:title: Group strategy-proof mechanisms

dcterms:creator: M. A. Fernandez
dcterms:description: Regret-free truth-telling is a concept in matching theory that allows agents to report their preferences without fear of regret, based on limited information about others' preferences.
dcterms:title: Regret-free truth-telling
